document.docAuthor: Konopko, Susana Amanda, Mazzucconi, Silvia Ana & Bachmann, Axel Oscar
document.masterDocTitle: Description of the immature stages of Trichocorixa mendozana Jaczewski (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Corixidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of the immature stages of Trichocorixa mendozana Jaczewski (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Corixidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
(
Figs. 1–27
,
Tables 1–3
)

Material examined. ARGENTINA : Buenos Aires Province, Laguna Chasicó,
XI– 1983
, Genise J. coll. (FCEyN – UBA) (nymphs: instar IV,
11 specimens
; V, 23 ); Buenos Aires Province, Salinas Chicas, at the road-side to Laguna Chasicó,
IV– 2010
, Konopko S.A. coll. (FCEyN – UBA) ( 10 oviposited eggs; nymphs: instar I,
12 specimens
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–5.
Trichocorixa mendozana
. 1, Egg. 2–3, Abdomen, instar I: 2, dorsal view; 3, ventral view. 4–5 , Pterothorax: 4 , instar IV; 5, instar V. Scale bars in mm: Figs. 1–4 = 0.50, Fig. 5 = 1.00.

FIGURES 6–14.
Trichocorixa mendozana
. 6–9, Antenna: 6 , ventral view, instar I; 7, dorsal view, instar IV; 8, ventral view, instar IV; 9, dorsal view, instar V. 10, lanceolate seta apically truncate on dorsal view of antennal segment II, instar V. 11 , antenna, ventral view, instar V. 12–14, proleg, anterior surface: 12, instar I; 13, instar IV; 14, instar V. A: anterior; AD: anterodorsal; AV: anteroventral; BT: behind tibial comb; CL: claw; DR: dorsal row; IS: inner surface; LR: lower row; TC: tibial comb; UR: upper row. Scale bars in mm: Fig. 6 = 0.05, Figs. 7–9, 11 = 0.20, Fig. 10 = 0.03, Fig. 12 = 0.08, Fig. 13 = 0.15, Fig. 14 = 0.30.

FIGURES 15–16.
Trichocorixa mendozana
. Mesoleg: 15–16, instar I: 15, anterior surface; 16, posterior surface. A: anterior; AD: anterodorsal; AV: anteroventral; P: posterior; PV: posteroventral; TC: tibial comb. Scale bars in mm: 0.20.

subSubSection.paragraph: Color. Ground color testaceous with dark markings. Head testaceous with dark markings, except ecdysial line and ventral and lateral surfaces testaceous. Eyes reddish brown. Rostrum testaceous except basally darker. Antennae testaceous with pale setae. Pronotum dark with two pale markings on each side of the segment. Meso- and metanotum testaceous with dark markings. Thoracic pleurae and sterna testaceous. Legs testaceous. Abdominal terga testaceous with dark markings; scent glands reddish brown on segments IV and V; abdominal sternites testaceous, except last segment with a rounded, middle, dark area. Conexivum testaceous.

Body. Suboval, BL/BW: 1.61–1.62 . Measurements that characterize the body shape are shown in
Table 1
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 17–20.
Trichocorixa mendozana
. Mesoleg: 17–18 , instar IV: 17, anterior surface; 18, posterior surface. 19–20, instar V: 19, anterior surface; 20, posterior surface. A: anterior; AD: anterodorsal; AV: anteroventral; P: posterior; PV: posteroventral; TC: tibial comb. Scale bars in mm: Figs. 17–18= 0.50, Figs. 19–20= 0.20.

subSubSection.paragraph: Second and third instars. No specimens were available for study.

Fourth instar ( Figs. 4 , 7–8, 13 ,
17 –18
,
23– 24
)
Similar to first instar except for the following features:

Color. Rostrum testaceous except basally and apically darker. Prosternum testaceous with dark markings on posterior margin of the segment. Posterior half of the mesonotum dark, with dark pubescence. Metatibia testaceous except anterior and posterior surfaces basally and apically darker. Conexivum with dark markings on posterior margin of each segment.

Body. Elongate, BL/BW: 1.77–1.88 . Measurements that characterize the body shape are shown in
Table 1
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Measurements (in mm) of instars I, IV and V of
Trichocorixa mendozana
. L: length; W: width. See Materials and methods for additional abbreviations.

FIGURES 21–24.
Trichocorixa mendozana
. Metaleg: 21–22, instar I: 21 , anterior surface; 22 , posterior surface. 23–24, instar IV: 23 , anterior surface; 24 , posterior surface. A: anterior; AD: anterodorsal; AV: anteroventral; LA: lower area; MA: middle area; P: posterior; PD: posterodorsal; PV: posteroventral; TC: tibial comb; UA: upper area; V: ventral. Scale bars in mm: Figs. 21–22= 0.20, Figs. 23–24= 0.30.

subSubSection.paragraph: Abdomen. Scent gland openings of segment III not distinct. G 4 /D 4 and G 5 /D 5 : 2 . Terga with abundant short, slender setae, some long, slender setae, and more chloride cells than in previous instar. Lateral spines of the abdominal segments on right/left sides: IV, 4 / 4 short, 2 / 2 long; V, 5 / 5 short, 5 / 5 long; VI, 5 / 5 short, 4 / 4 long; VII, 7 / 6 short, 6 / 6 long; VIII, 8 / 8 short, 7 / 7 long. Sterna with abundant short and long, slender setae, and without chloride cells. Urosternites I–VIII without central spines.
Similar to fourth instar except for the following features:
Color. Posterior margin of head, inner and posterior margins of metathoracic wing pads darker.

Body. More elongate than previous instar. BL/BW: 2.01–2.34 . Measurements that characterize the body shape are shown in
Table 1
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 25–27.
Trichocorixa mendozana
. Metaleg: 25–26, instar V: 25 , anterior surface; 26 , posterior surface. 27 , apically serrate spines on the posteroventral surface of the metatibia, instar V. Scale bars in mm: Fig. 25= 0.50, Fig. 26= 0.60, Fig. 27= 0.06.

subSubSection.paragraph: Abdomen. Lateral spines of abdominal segments on right/left sides: IV, 5 / 5 short, 2 / 2 long; V, 5 / 4 short, 4 / 5 long; VI, 7 / 8 short, 3 / 3 long; VII, 10 / 13 short, 4–5 / 4 long; VIII, 8–9 / 8 short, 7 / 7 long.
